reviews.review_msg: Totally awesome. Kind, caring and invested in the material. Brings first-hand knowledge to class. Is a total babe. If she was snappy to you at some point, it was probably your fault.
Not very easy to understand, and didnt have time for students. Always seemed stressed and was snappy when picking up assignments.
Not very easy to understand. Snappy and rude to the students during office hours. I didnt like her at all

She is super nice and very open to questions. She cares for the class by constantly asking if she was clear enough. Her lectures are clear because she uses simple words we can understand. 3 hours long though! Her tests are mostly lecture based, but there are still some text questions.

The exams were extremely difficult and it felt impossible to prep for. The grading is very intense for a class without tutorials. There are some classes you take and you feel like the prof wants to see student success and this was not one of those courses.

One of my favourite profs I've had so far. Makes great use of examples from her clinical experience and you can tell she is very knowledgeable. Definitely need to study for exams, but if you do you'll be fine. Lecture slides and articles important. Very caring and overall great prof.

Dr. Owens is engaging, she uses lots of examples from her work as a clinician to explain lectures content. Exams are relatively easy and the assignment was a breeze if you know how to properly summarize a research article. Easy GPA booster

very likeable, educated, passionate professor. would rate a 5 is but her exams felt unnecessarily hard, not necessarily unfair, but, questions are super indirect and you would need content studied down to the bone to answer MCs correctly. still is possible to do well in this course if you work / study hard. wouldn't avoid just because its hard.

Lynnaea is a super kind and caring professor with a great amount of knowledge in clinical psychology. I liked how she used her own experiences to add context to the material. The brochure assignment was straightforward but the midterm and final were slightly harder than the norm even with it being mostly multiple choice for both. Overall 7.5/10

Good lecture content, simple brochure assignment, however I felt that her exams were way too hard, MC ranging from A-E, it felt like she was trying to trick us, average was in the 60s as well. Readings were too long to try and remember for the exams. Attendance was kinda mandatory for in class reflection. Not a bad class, just make sure you study!

Take this class if you want to tank your GPA. Lectures were engaging, good ratio of lecture slides to concept videos shown in class. Due to the strike, we ended up having grades proportioned differently (exams worth more). For the love of god why were the exams so hard. I walked out of the midterm questioning life. TA grading was unnecessarily hard

The course content is interesting. I was quite surprised with delivery, testing, harsher grading by the TAs. Being a young prof, it was surprising to see her upholding the status quo (i.e., scaling to B-, more focus on exams etc.) 
Exams were unnecessarily hard, Mid-term average was 66% with deliberately confusing MCQ's. Expect a GPA tanking.

Dr Owens is very intelligent and the course content is interesting. Her classes can be pretty dull at times though (especially in the first few weeks). 

Her tests are way too challenging. The multiple choice questions were borderline mean lol

Dr. Owens is a great professor. She genuinely cares about the content and makes lectures more engaging than they should be. The flip side is that her exams are very tough, she does a great job of hiding the answers in her multiple choice.
Awesome Professor would highly recommend taking 371 with her.

An amazing prof! She relates a lot of the material from her own client experiences and is the sweetest person ever. She's always open to feedback and is always open to questions. She posts all her slides but going to lectures is really helpful. Test are heavily relied on textbooks but she tells you which pages you need to read and even gives tips!!

Difficult exams. 60 multiple choice questions and a short answer question. Lecture slides are pretty vague so you HAVE to read the textbook which is very dense. If you want to do well in this course, you have to study very hard.
a great lecturer but her test is not easy. you would need to look on your textbook carefully and do memorization.

Lynnaea was a great prof! Her lectures were very engaging. There are a fair bit of questions on exams that come directly from the textbook so you need to take thorough notes if you want an A. The textbook is pretty dense, but if you come to lecture Lynnaea tells you what sections to skip. The paper was tough to fit in 5 pages so start early!

Best Prof. ever!! Yael is an incredible professor. Her lectures are interesting, she has great stories that helps you understand the materials. Her exams are MC only, based on lectures mostly. Very fair grading. As long as you stick to her instructions, you'll do great.

Yael is amazing! You have to attend lectures to get a better understanding of the material, especially because the tests are MC and based on lectures! For a three hour class, she made it go by fast. Material is interesting and grading is fair. No tricks, just do as told and you'll do great!

Yael is nice and easy to talk to, lectures are worth going to for better understanding of things and knowing the key things. Has lots of stories to help information stick. Where it lacked: how to use textbook to better correspond with the exams. Exams are DETAILED oriented from lectures/textbook/scenario questions but all MC.

Definitely the worst prof I've had. Way too many class pairing activities that takes away from lectures. Goes too quickly through material. Said she would tell us what to study for the exam, but only generally told us how to study for any exam. Exams are very difficult (small, unimportant details). Doesn't know basic psyc (e.g., reinforcement).

I really liked Prof. Mayer lectures, she is really knowledgeable and passionate about Psychology. Really liked her and her course but didn't like her exams. They are difficult and she asks about small unimportant details you have to memorize.

I really enjoyed Professor Mayer's class. Great lectures, very interesting materials. The exams are challenging, they are MC questions, you need to study . Eventually the grading was fair. Professor Mayer was really kind and friendly. Overall great course!

Dr. Mayer is very knowledgeable, and this show. The course is based off of 2 midterms and 1 paper. She has many interesting stories from her own practice and her lectures are not bad. However, she gives you no outline for what's going to be on the exams. Just says, "Anything said in lecture is fair game." Impossible to study for.

This course has the potential to be incredible, but was severely hindered by Dr. Mayer's style of teaching. The discrepancies between what she asks us to do in class and the syllabus, combined with disjointed lectures and unnecessarily difficult/confusing exams made this class really not worth taking. (plus she doesn't know what APA style is...?)

Dr. Mayer is an amazing Prof!! She is so knowledgeable, she uses lots of examples from her own professional experience. She also encourages class discussions, she is very kind and open for questions, and she really cares about her students. I wish I had more Profs like her.

Dr. Mayer is super friendly and passionate about psychology and teaching. She is approachable and wants students to do well which helps (easy participation marks and bonus questions on midterm). Biggest critique is that assigned chapters were really long and exams asked obscure details. Grading criteria for final projects were not helpful.

Brooke is the BEST! Love her, this class taught me a lot about my own self therapy and psychology as in general. Great course, I think everyone should take this just to educate ourselves about how our minds work. The class was not easy but not hard, very very fair. If you do the readings you will ACE it. She is great. Fun and knows her field.

Brooke's a highly intelligent & experienced teacher- very sweet & educated. Only downfall is her lecture notes are all over the place, but listening to lecture recordings really help. 2 assignments- both alright. Midterms & final are filled with VERY detailed shorrt answers of all types, covering lots of material. Class requires heavy studying..
nice prof. class was a lot of fun. she is also very experienced. I found the exams and assignments pretty easy. the TA, Kate is awesome.wish she taught other courses. just study and you'll do fine.

LOVE Brooke! She's young, spunky, upbeat, and fresh - a nice change from the old geezers kicking around in the psych dept. Her interest level in the material was very high so it translated well in lectures. Exams were easy with no trick questions. I just wish she didn't use the Barlow book. A waste of money since we only read like 3 chapters in it.

I really like Brooke! Her teaching style is pretty straight forward, shes young and has lots of experience, which provides her with lots of relevant stories, which is probably what sets her apart.  It seems some profs have been teaching for so long, that they forget what ACTUALLY happens in practice - but Brooke has lots of experience! keep it up!

Good class. Overall, brookes lectures were frustrating at first (not organized), but they got better and you have to go to class. assignments are easy. tests are fair, if you study you will do well. the short answer is long - know her slides. will ask you to list things in short answer questions. interesting material and she teaches well.
Class isn't hard at all. Compared to some other classes in psych department. Plus Brooke's hot. also has hot TA named Katie. Gives you extra motivations to go to class.

Brooke was a pretty decent prof, was very nice and always tried to be as helpful and clear as she could. Exams were tricky, but study the lecture notes and whatever seems important in the text (btw: it's huge but only a few chapters are assigned so don't worry). Assignments pretty simple/easy/short but interesting, final WAY easier than midterms.

Pretty decent class and interesting as well. It consisted of predominantly lecture material with a selection from the textbook and journal articles. Exams are average and sorta tricky but the final was a gift. Just know the lecture material pretty well and you should be fine. Good class overall would definitely take again.

I don't know if Brooke's lecturing style got better later (hopefully it did--she looks like a really nice person), but the first lecture was so frustratingly unclear that I dropped the class after it.

I do not recommend Psychology students to take a course with this professor. It was hard keeping up since the professor tends to skip class (at least twice). Also, the textbook material seems irrelevant. The professor was not helpful after class and seemed rather rude. Avoid this course if you can...

This class had great potential but I'm afraid it was taught in a very confusing manner, not corresponding well to the textbook. Assignment expectations were unclear even after asking TA for clarification. Strict on rules and penalties but changed the rules regularly (etc. did not teach two chapters off syllabus - which I was looking forward to)

Meh. The exam questions, although multiple choice, are far too particular. She makes the slightest variation of the correct answer on numerous questions (aka tricking). In addition, a lot of questions seemed irrelevant and too detailed. I am an 'A' student in my last semester and I have never taken an exam like this in psychology.

took her intersession class last summer and it was great! interesting lectures, very organized, clear expectations. i didn't really read much of the textbook but took a lot of notes in class and read her slides for exams and I did pretty ok. has very clear expectations, she's very interested in the subject, very willing to answer questions.

Articulate, coherent, and interesting. She knows what shes talking about and speaks with a lot of clarity. Exams are fair, mostly based from the slides.  learned a lot that could be applied to rl, ie what treatment works? relevant to my life tbh
If you are good with memorization and regurgitation type exams this class is for you. If you have any actual interest in practical applications stay as far away from this course as possible.

Bri was awesome. She has excellent ability to articulate complex material in the way it's easily understood. Study and review frequently as there's quite a lot of material covered. Exams are not extremely difficult. The only thing I was not content with was TAs marking our assignments. I think it was very subjective, but that's just my opinion.

New prof or not, Bri is amazing! Even though her classes were at 8AM I attended all of them & enjoyed every single one. Tests weren't difficult so long as you attended lecture/paid attention. Papers were fair. She is highly engaging, knowledgeable, & genuinely wants her students to do well. Would definitely recommend her for this course and others!

I would not recommend taking this prof unless you want to lower your GPA. She is nice but her exams are VERY picky and difficult!! The amount of reading you have to do is ridiculous, she assigns textbook chapters, and articles, and your expected to attend her 3 hour lecture every week (attendance is 5%). She made a very easy course difficult.

WOW! Bri is great. Even though she is PhD student, she is an amazing proff. She loves her students, and psychology. Understanding he lectures was a breeze! Show up to every class as there is a short pass/fail writing assignment (so easy)!
